originalText.text: I have always wanted to try this place. I took my daughter and we really enjoyed it. The food was great fast service also. Everyone from the staff was amazing awesome service. The music keep us hype and the overall feeling of the place was amazing vibe. üëè  Can't wait to go back

originalText.text: Cool spot & great happy hour. I walked by, and the happy hour specials caught my attention. Plates starting at $4 & up. I sat at the bar, and ordered the fried calamari  $9 which looked like onion rings. It was shaped round, good crispy taste served with a brown sauce. And a gyoza plate, $4 fried served with dumpling sauce. I opted for a cold sake bottle $16 instead of drink specials. Together with tip, $39.  Staff was friendly and good customer service. Great vibes. Would definitely visit again.

originalText.text: Food is always phenomenal. The food takes a very long time to arrive, the service could be better and is getting better. I would say the manager is very rude to his employees, It feels like he‚Äôs always breathing down their neck. The atmosphere is very nice for any occasion whether it‚Äôs a date or just getting sushi somewhere nice.

originalText.text:
Have been here twice so far for dinner after work during the week.
I‚Äôm nothing but positive about both experiences!
Food is great, service is good and vibe is fun & chill!

The happy hour menu is wonderful!
Valid every day (besides holidays) from 3pm til 7:30pm.

What I personally love about Geisha Asian Fushion is that they have vegetarian friendly options for vegetarians like myself.
I had the sweet potato and peanut avocado (cooked) sushi rolls and both are delicious ($7 per roll)!
From the happy hour menu I had the scallion pancake ($7), which was a good portion and yummy!

The owner is very kind and so are the staff! Service is kind and quite fast! If you‚Äôre picky with where you initially get seated (like I can be), the owner and staff are very accommodating (depending on how busy it is at the moment of course). But I personally appreciate this very much!

The establishment is very well taken care of. It‚Äôs clean, modern looking with a fun ‚Äúlounge‚Äù vibe to it with Japanese art on the walls.

FYI: 18% gratuity is included already when you get your receipt.
But it is done in an honest manner, because there are stickers on the menu that clearly state it.
And the owner also mentioned it when he handed over the receipt.

The only negative thing I have to say is that I‚Äôm bummed out I don‚Äôt live closer!ü•≤(We live a few stops away with the A train)
I‚Äôd pick up sushi every week here if it was walking distance from where we live.

I definitely recommend everyone to give Geisha a try when craving sushi or Asian fusion foods!

originalText.text:
This review is about an order I placed for pick up today July 29, 2023. Everything went smoothly over the phone, placed the order and paid because my sister was going to pick it up. (I was alone with my kids, so she offered to pick it up)

I requested extra ginger for 4 rolls (see picture) , I specifically told my sister to remind them about the extra ginger. When she did the woman in the counter told her ‚ÄúEach roll comes with ginger‚Äù OF COURSE! It is not the first time I eat sushi. Anyway, my sister did not check, when she came not only the sushi rolls where squeezed in one box, but the amount of sushi included was enough for one piece (remember I ordered 4 rolls! That is 24 pieces!) that is why I ordered extra ginger!

I called right back to complain about my missing extra ginger, and they in a unapologetic way told me, ‚Äúif you want extra sushi you should come and get it‚Äù‚Ä¶

Last time ordering from this place‚Ä¶ food is good, but the customer service is deplorable‚Ä¶
